# nibrsr

<!-- badges: start -->
[![Lifecycle: experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://lifecycle.r-lib.org/articles/stages.html#experimental)
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/nibrsr)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=nibrsr)
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/higherX4Racine/nibrsr/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/higherX4Racine/nibrsr/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml)
[![Codecov test coverage](https://codecov.io/gh/higherX4Racine/nibrsr/graph/badge.svg)](https://app.codecov.io/gh/higherX4Racine/nibrsr)
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of nibrsr is to work with data from the FBI's
[National Incident-Based Reporting System](https://cde.ucr.cjis.gov/).

## Installation

You can install the development version of nibrsr from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("higherX4Racine/nibrsr")
```
